name: trinotate
description:
Trinotate is a comprehensive annotation suite designed for automatic
functional annotation of transcriptomes, particularly de novo assembled
transcriptomes, from model or non-model organisms

dependencies.name: trinity
dependencies.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.

dependencies.name: transdecoder
dependencies.description:
TransDecoder identifies candidate coding regions within transcript
sequences, such as those generated by de novo RNA-Seq transcript
assembly using Trinity, or constructed based on RNA-Seq alignments to
the genome using Tophat and Cufflinks.

dependencies.name: sqlite
dependencies.description:
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-
contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

dependencies.name: hmmer
dependencies.description:
HMMER is used for searching sequence databases for sequence homologs,
and for making sequence alignments. It implements methods using
probabilistic models called profile hidden Markov models (profile HMMs).

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: lighttpd
dependencies.description: a secure, fast, compliant and very flexible web-server

dependencies.name: perl-dbi
dependencies.description:
The DBI is the standard database interface module for Perl. It defines a
set of methods, variables and conventions that provide a consistent
database interface independent of the actual database being used.

dependencies.name: perl-cgi
dependencies.description:
CGI - Handle Common Gateway Interface requests and responses CGI was
included in the Perl distribution from 5.4 to 5.20 but has since been
removed.

dependencies.name: perl-dbd-sqlite
dependencies.description: DBD::SQLite - Self-contained RDBMS in a DBI Driver
